63.author: John W
63.appears_in: Dodds. chapter 8 (p. 213-235) in his Everyday Life in Twentieth Century America (New York : Putnam, 1965).
notes: Summary: Discussion of humor magazines, comedians, satire and comics, with sample illustrations by Clare Briggs (When a Feller Needs a Friend), John Held Jr., Charles Schulz (Peanuts), R.F. Outcault (The Yellow Kid, Buster Brown), F. Opper (Happy Hooligan), R. Dirks (The Katzenjammer Kids), George McManus (Bringing Up Father), Bud Fisher (Mutt and Jeff), Frank King (Gasoline Alley), and mention of others.

notes: Summary: A man is staggering down the street and big brother think's he's a drunk, but the Worry Wart says he's only walking a busybody wire-haired dog.

124.heading: Busybody.
124.title: Dennis the Menace : Busybody
124.author: by Hank Ketcham.
notes: 1 v. : ill. ; 19 cm.
(A Fawcett Gold Medal Book) 1. Funny kid comics. I. Ketcham, Hank, 1920- II. Busybody. III. Series. Call no.: PN6728.D4B8 1973

125.heading: Busyness.
125.title: "The Doer"
125.author: by Barbara Brandon.
notes: Summary: Nicole is always busy, and has forgotten how to just plain be, and asks Judy what she can do about it.

126.heading: Busyness.
126.title: "Excepción" ; p. 24 in Condorito Gigante, no. 418
126.author: [No author]
notes: SUMMARY: Condorito visits a man who's so busy and important that he's turned away 12 previous visitors today; Condorito says he knows that's true because he tried to get in 12 times.
2 tiers.

127.heading: Busyness.
127.title: "For Once He'll Skip the Details"
127.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: At the poker game, the Owls want to know how his slippers wager with the boarders came out; he won but he's been so busy with research he tends to forget about minor diversions.

128.heading: Busyness.
128.title: "Great! I'll Pick Up a Nice Bottle of Shampoo!"
128.author: Johnson.
notes: Summary: She's busy tonight, washing her hair.

129.heading: Busyness.
129.title: "Just Lucky, I Guess"
129.author: Bittle.
notes: Summary: Artie has invited Rabbit to dinner 10 times, and every time he's been busy. Why is that?

130.heading: Busyness.
130.title: "Thank God Women's Lib Hasn't Killed Mother's Day!"
130.author: B
130.appears_in: Tobey (copyright 1973). p. 119 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Florists are talking in a busy shop.

131.title: Buster Brown
notes: Newspaper comic strip. See also under Tige (the dog character)
